title: Semantic keypoint-based pose estimation from single RGB frames

Object pose estimation with statistical.ref_texts: [79] Karl Schmeckpeper, Philip R Osteen, Yufu Wang, Georgios Pavlakos, Kenneth Chaney, Wyatt Jordan, Xiaowei Zhou, Konstantinos G Derpanis, and Kostas Daniilidis. Semantic keypoint-based pose estimation from single RGB frames. J. of Field Robotics , 2022. 1,4,7
Object pose estimation with statistical.1: One of the most popular paradigms for object pose estimation is a two-stage pipeline [20,71,72,79,81,85,89,101], where the first stage detects (semantic) keypoints of the objects on the image, and the second stage computes the object pose by solving an optimization known as Perspectiven-Points (PnP) that minimizes reprojection errors of the detected keypoints.
Object pose estimation with statistical.2: We choose the heatmap approach in [71,79] as the prediction function: given an image x,[79] outputs a set of heatmaps f(x)=(f(x)1,.
Object pose estimation with statistical.3: Our approach conformalizes the heatmaps [79] as (ball) or (ellipse ).
Object pose estimation with statistical.4: The implementation8 of [79] uses either groundtruth or Faster RCNN [75] bounding boxes, giving four variants of our approach: groundtruth box plus (ball) or (ellipse ) (labels: gt-ball ,gt-ellipse ), and Faster RCNN box plus (ball) or (ellipse ) (labels: frcnn-ball , frcnn-ellipse ).
